alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN GRANT, OWEN AND CENTRAL GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1138 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles southeast of Carrollton, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Glencoe, Corinth, Sparta, Monterey, Gratz, Stewartsville, Elk Lake, Long Ridge, Wheatley, Eagle Hill, New Liberty, Twin Bridges, Squiresville, Keefer, Needmore, Holbrook and Elmer Davis Lake. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 158 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
